item.title: Quantization-Aware Training of jina-embeddings-v4
item.description: Quantization gives smaller embeddings. We show you fine-tuned quantization gives you even lossless embeddings.
item.dc:creator: Andrei Ungureanu

item.title: Jina Embeddings v4: Universal Embeddings for Multimodal Multilingual Retrieval
item.description: Jina Embeddings v4 is a 3.8 billion parameter universal embedding model for multimodal and multilingual retrieval that supports both single-vector and multi-vector embedding outputs.
item.dc:creator: Jina AI

item.title: Correlations: Vibe-Testing Embeddings in GUI
item.description: As serious as we are about MTEB, we also love vibe-testing. Correlations is a simple GUI we use for validating citations in DeepSearch, debugging late chunking, and vibe-testing embeddings. Now it's open-source.
item.dc:creator: Jina AI

item.title: What We Learned at ICLR2025
item.description: We collect some most interesting papers in ICLR 2025, featuring TIPS, FlexPrefill, Zero-Shot Rerankers, SVD-LLM, Hymba etc.
item.dc:creator: Jina AI

item.title: Fair Scoring for Multimodal Documents with jina-reranker-m0
item.description: Text similarity: 0.7. Image similarity: 0.5. Which document is more relevant? You literally cannot tell—and that's the core problem breaking multimodal search. We solve it with unified reranking.
item.dc:creator: Nan Wang

item.title: Model Soup’s Recipe for Embeddings
item.description: Boost robustness and performance with model soups: averaging weights. No extra cost, better results.
item.dc:creator: Bo Wang

item.title: On the Size Bias of Text Embeddings and Its Impact in Search
item.description: Size bias refers to how the length of text inputs affects similarity, regardless of semantic relevance. It explains why search systems sometimes return long, barely-relevant documents instead of shorter, more precise matches to your query.
item.dc:creator: Scott Martens

item.title: jina-reranker-m0: Multilingual Multimodal Document Reranker
item.description: Introducing jina-reranker-m0, our new multilingual multimodal reranker for retrieving visual documents, with SOTA performance on multilingual long documents and code searching tasks.
item.dc:creator: Jina AI

item.title: Using DeepSeek R1 Reasoning Model in DeepSearch
item.description: Standard LLM or reasoning model, which is better for DeepSearch? In this post, we explored using DeepSeek-R1 in the DeepSearch implementation for choosing the next action.
item.dc:creator: Andrei Ungureanu

item.title: DeepSearch on Private Visual Documents: An Enterprise Case Study
item.description: Our DeepSearch works with private PDFs and visual documents right out of the box. Discover how DeepSearch can unlock valuable insights from your enterprise data.
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Werk

item.title: Snippet Selection and URL Ranking in DeepSearch/DeepResearch
item.description: Nailing these two details takes your DeepSearch from mid to GOAT: selecting the best snippets from lengthy webpages and ranking URLs before crawling.
item.dc:creator: Han Xiao

item.title: Long-Context Embedding Models are Blind Beyond 4K Tokens
item.description: We investigate embedding models on new "needle-in-haystack" tasks and find that beyond 4K tokens, they're just rolling dice - even with exact lexical matches or query expansion, they can't tell signal from noise in long context.
item.dc:creator: Saahil Ognawala

item.title: LLM-as-SERP: Search Engine Result Pages from Large Language Models
item.description: This idea either extremely smart or extremely stupid—no in-between. Read till the end and find out why this could be useful.
item.dc:creator: Han Xiao

item.title: A Practical Guide to Implementing DeepSearch/DeepResearch
item.description: QPS out, depth in. DeepSearch is the new norm. Find answers through read-search-reason loops. Learn what it is and how to build it.
item.dc:creator: Han Xiao

item.title: Query Expansion with LLMs: Searching Better by Saying More
item.description: Search has changed a lot since embedding models were introduced. Is there still a role for lexical techniques like query expansion in AI? We think so.
item.dc:creator: Michael Günther
